availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Sanford William Sigler (Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer, apprentice, pvt & corp 20th KY Inf USA)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer, apprentice cabinetmaker, and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of John Sigler and Peggy Sigler. Farmer and student in Caldwell County in 1850. Apprentice cabinetmaker for A. C. Thompson in Caldwell County in 1860. Served in the 20th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private and corporal from January 6, 1862, to January 17, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 343A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 113.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Precinct 2, p. 40B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0333.
"Sanford W. Sigler (1835-1906)," Find A Grave, Memorial #15994674, accessed January 26, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/15994674.
